channel.title: Knowledge-base on NJIT.io
channel.description: Recent content in Knowledge-base on NJIT.io

item.title: Game Boy CPU basics
item.description: Writing assembly code for the Game Boy isn’t as hard as it first may seem. Here are some basic things that you need to know before getting stuck into it.

item.title: Things to know before starting Game Boy development
item.description: Interested in Game Boy development but want to get a bit of an idea what’s involved first? Here’s a quick list of things I think are useful to know.

item.title: Windows 11 UI registry hacks
item.description: Some simple registry hacks for alterating the Windows 11 UI.

item.title: How to compile Iperf3 for Windows using Cygwin
item.description: How to use Cygwin to compile Iperf3 for Windows.

item.title: Windows Security Events
item.description: Some useful Windows event IDs to know when auditing security logs.

item.title: Repairing and rebuild WMI repository
item.description: Many services rely on WMI to work. When it doesn’t work you can try to repair/rebuild it.

item.title: Installing Apache Guacamole in Ubuntu
item.description: How to install Apache Guacamole on an Ubuntu server

item.title: Installing .NET 2 & 3.5 feature from Windows installation media
item.description: In the case of having to install legacy .NET versions but the Windows Feature GUI is throwing an error try this.

item.title: Mounting VMDK files (read-only) in Ubuntu
item.description: How to mount a VMDK file in an Ubuntu shell.

item.title: Nutanix AHV host manual shutdown/reboot procedure
item.description: The procedure for shutting down or rebooting a host in a Nutanix cluster.

item.title: Renaming Nutanix AHV host and Controller VM
item.description: A quick guide on how to rename a host and its CVM

item.title: How to create and destroy a cluster from Nutanix CVM
item.description: How to create a single-node or multiple-node cluster from inside a Nutanix Controller VM, complete some initial configuration and if you like destroy the cluster once done.

item.title: Nutanix default credentials
item.description: Default credentials for various Nutanix components

item.title: Services in systemd
item.description: A brief overview of working with service units in systemd.

item.title: Targets in systemd
item.description: Similar to System V’s runlevels, systemd has targets. Targets are groups of units that represent different levels of operation.

item.title: Windows version numbers
item.description: If you need a quick way to determine which version of Windows something is running you can do this quick check.

item.title: Mounting VMFS volume (read-only) in Ubuntu
item.description: How to mount a VMFS volume in an Ubuntu shell.

item.title: Server remote management default credentials
item.description: Default credentials for IBM, Lenovo, Dell, HP, Fujitsu and Acer server remote management systems

item.title: Windows Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) cheat-sheet
item.description: Use DISM to switch Windows editions or repair a broken Windows deployment.

item.title: Windows Software Licensing Management Tool (slmgr.vbs) cheat-sheet
item.description: Example commands for using slmgr.vbs which is a visual basic script provided in Windows Vista/Server 2008 (and newer) that allows you to configure Windows licensing.

item.title: Configuring Windows networking via command-line with NETSH
item.description: Some basic commands for modifying the IP of a network interface in Windows.

item.title: Network routes via Windows command-line
item.description: Some basic commands for managing network routes in Windows.

item.title: VMware ESXi command-line cheat-sheet
item.description: Cheat-sheet for useful commands you can run via the ESXi shell.

item.title: WMIC examples
item.description: Some basic commands for using WMIC to interact with Windows Management Instrumentation.
